alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 5:44AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...Elevated Water Levels Possible Sunday Along the Kuskokwim Delta Coast... A storm system moving across the Northern Bering over the weekend will lead to the development of strong southerly winds from Kuskokwim Bay through the Etolin Strait for Sunday. The strong southerly winds will bring elevated water levels with the potential for water pushing up through cracks in the ice and ice pushing up on shore along south and west facing shorelines. Winds will shift to the southwest and eventually west by late Sunday night as a front moves onshore. The greatest chance for elevated water levels and potential ice shoves is expected to be in an area of coastline from Quinhagak to Kipnuk. Water levels are expected to rise Sunday morning with the highest levels expected late Sunday afternoon before slowly subsiding Sunday night. A second round of elevated water levels is possible Monday afternoon as another front moves toward the coast with increasing southerly winds. Residents with interests along the coast should move items well above the normal high tide level. For the latest forecast updates, please visit www.weather.gov/afc
